Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • qwirkle.Player
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ComputerPlayer, HumanPlayer

    public abstract class Player
extends java.lang.Object
    Creating a player
    Version:
    1.1
    Author:
    Niek Tijink & Thomas Kolner

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Player(java.lang.String name)
      Creates a new Player with an empty hand

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addScore(int a)
      increases the score
      void addToHand(java.lang.String tiles)
      This method is used by the client to fill the hand with the new tiles he received
      java.lang.String changeStones(java.lang.String[] msg, Deck deck)
      When a client decides to swap, this method is used by the server to change stones
      void deleteTiles(java.lang.String tiles)
      Used by the client to delete tiles from his hand This is necessary because the client does not delete his tiles when he sends his move to the server He deletes the tiles when the server says the move is valid

      gets a new move from either ComputerPlayer or HumanPlayer

      gives the current hand (an array of tiles) of the player

      gives the name of the player

      get the place in your hand (0-5) of a tile

      initializes a move After initialising it can be filled and tested

      Method used by the server to determine if a move is valid if the move is valid, it is placed on the board
      java.lang.String updateHand(Deck deck)
      fills the hand of the player with new stones This method is used by the Server to get the stones

    • Method Detail

      • getScore

        public int getScore()
        returns the current score
        Returns:
        the score

      • addScore

        public void addScore(int a)
        increases the score
        Parameters:
        a - the number which the score should be increased

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        gives the name of the player
        Returns:
        the name

      • updateHand

        public java.lang.String updateHand(Deck deck)
        fills the hand of the player with new stones This method is used by the Server to get the stones
        Parameters:
        deck - Deck where the new stones come from
        Returns:
        a String containing all new Tiles (as character)

      • getHand

        public Tile[] getHand()
        gives the current hand (an array of tiles) of the player
        Returns:
        the hand

      • getPlaceInHand

        public int getPlaceInHand(Tile tile)
        get the place in your hand (0-5) of a tile
        Parameters:
        tile - The Tile you want to check
        Returns:
        the place in your hand (0-5) or -1 if the tile is not in your hand

      • initialiseMove

        public void initialiseMove()
        initializes a move After initialising it can be filled and tested

      • makeMove

        public java.lang.String makeMove(Board board,
                        java.lang.String msg)
        Method used by the server to determine if a move is valid if the move is valid, it is placed on the board
        Parameters:
        board - the current board
        msg - the move (as a string)
        Returns:
        ERROR if the move invalid, "true" if the move is valid

      • determineMove

        public abstract java.lang.String determineMove(Board board)
        gets a new move from either ComputerPlayer or HumanPlayer
        Parameters:
        board - the current board
        Returns:
        the move (as string)

      • changeStones

        public java.lang.String changeStones(java.lang.String[] msg,
                            Deck deck)
        When a client decides to swap, this method is used by the server to change stones
        Parameters:
        msg - the new Tiles (as String)
        deck - the deck where the new stones come from
        Returns:
        Nothing if the player doesnt have the tiles he wants to swap, else new Tiles (as string)

      • addToHand

        public void addToHand(java.lang.String tiles)
               throws exception.OutOfSyncException
        This method is used by the client to fill the hand with the new tiles he received
        Parameters:
        tiles - the new tiles
        Throws:
        exception.OutOfSyncException - if the client gets more new tiles than he has empty spots in his hand

      • getHandString

        public java.lang.String getHandString()
        translates the hand to a string to print on the TUI
        Returns:
        the hand (as String)

      • deleteTiles

        public void deleteTiles(java.lang.String tiles)
        Used by the client to delete tiles from his hand This is necessary because the client does not delete his tiles when he sends his move to the server He deletes the tiles when the server says the move is valid
        Parameters:
        tiles - the tiles to be deleted
